title: Exosome_H_PDLSCs_rep1
characteristics_ch1.1: cell type: healthy periodontal ligament stem cells (H-PDLSCs)
characteristics_ch1.2: cell source: obtained from healthy periodontal ligament tissue
treatment_protocol_ch1: The culture supernatants of healthy PDLSCs (H-PDLSCs, obtained from healthy periodontal ligament tissue) and inflammatory PDLSCs(P-PDLSCs, obtained from periodontitis periodontal ligament tissue; L-PDLSCs,H-PDLSCs treated with 100 ng/mL lipopolysaccharide for 7 days) were used for exosomes extraction by using ultracentrifuge.
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was prepared using the TRIzol reagent following the manufacturer's recommendations.  RNA was quantified using a NanoDrop-1000 spectrophotometer and RNA integrity was determined by 1% formaldehyde denaturing gel electrophoresis.
label_protocol_ch1: The miRNAs were labeled using the Agilent miRNA labeling reagent. Total RNA (200 ng) was dephosphorylated and ligated with pCp-Cy3, the labeled RNA was purified and hybridized to miRNA arrays.
hyb_protocol: According to the Agilent miRNA Microarray Protocol (Agilent Technologies).
scan_protocol: After hybridization and washes, slides were scanned immediately in Agilent Microarray Scanner with Surescan High Resolution Technology (Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA).
data_processing: Feature Extraction v10.10 (Agilent Technologies, CA) software was used to extract all features of the data obtained from the scanned images and Bioconductor software was used to analyze the raw data, which are normalized by percentile normalization.
cell source:ch1: obtained from healthy periodontal ligament tissue
